summary: more than 100,000 cases of HFRS are reported annually, with a mortality rate between 2% and 10%. HTNV is a spherical, enveloped virus with a genome composed of three segments of single-stranded, negative-sense RNA. the three segments are designated as large (L), medium (M) and small (S) segments that encode RNA-dependent RNA polymerase. IL-2 is one of the extensively studied cytokine adjuvants. it increased the development of antigen-specific immune response and protective immunity against challenge with the infectious agents. previous studies have shown that co-expression of IL-2 has also been shown to enhance the immune response to the HSV1 glycoprotein D antigen in DNA vaccines. eukaryotic expression plasmid DNA vector was amplified from plasmid PUC19-IL-2 (Department of molecular biology, Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China) the full-length IL-2 DNA was amplified from plasmid PUC19-IL-2 (Department of molecular biology, Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China encoding G2 gene by PCR using primers(forward, 5'- GGGGTACCTACGGGCTGCAAGTGCTTCTGAAAC -3'reverse, 5'- CCGCTCGAGTAGGACTATGCCTTCTTGTGC -3') designed to introduce KpnI and XhIrestriction sites at 5' and 3'ends of the amplicons, respectively, and subcloned into pcDNA3.1/IL-2 at the cell lysates were run on sodium dodecyl sulfate-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis (SDS-PAGE) and then transferred electrophoretically to a nitrocellulose membrane. the membranes were incubated with monoclonal antibody (MAb) against IL-2 (Santa Cruz, CA, USA, at 1:50 dilution) cells cultured at 37°C in a shaking incubator overnight. a final concentration of 0.3 mM of IPTG was added to the culture. the cells were harvested by centrifugation in 50 ml volumes. serum HTNV G2 and IL-2 specific antibodies Sera were collected from a retroorbital plexus puncture 10 days after last protein boost or an animal's tail vein puncture of immunized mice at weeks 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14 and 16. the sera were serially diluted and reacted with G2 and IL-2 antigen.
